title: Drawing, "Design for an Altar: Elevation, with Trompe-l'Oeil Plan Below", 1750–75
medium: Pen and brown ink, gray, red wash, over graphite, ruled border in pen and brown on white laid paper
markings: Recto in red ink: stamp of the Museum of the arts of Decoration (Cooper Union) [Lugt 457c]
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, on plan below: cornices del quadro; scalino, Ara; Pradella [frame of the painting; step; altar; platform]
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Centrally placed elevation of altar showing painting of a penitent saint in the wilderness. Above in a circular frame the heads of two cherubs. Altarpiece flanked by Corinthian topped pilasters.  Group of three figures at left of altar, one of which holds a lance. At right, one figure carries candlesticks. Below elevation, a sheet of paper containing a plan view, is drawn in trompe-l'oeil and edged with red. Edges appear rolled and an elaborate frame is shown at right, behind the sheet.
